channel.title: Recolor
channel.description: Simple question. Post thoughts below. I say remove them altogether. Keep them on your p server, not mopar.

item.title: Recolor
item.dc:creator: @Wildyscape562 Wildyscape562
item.description:
@Wildyscape562 wrote:

This is 100% NO, because you should create your own from scratch not take off Jagex ideas… What is the point, yeah you want to add more detail to it, well then show us what you got, dont edit someone elses damn model… Im a new modeler and i haven’t even done that… There are SOME “Pro Modelers” that do this, well sorry but in my book the “Pros” are the people that put time and effort into their OWN models. Just My 2 Cents Did not mean to offend anyone by my post, and to those that i did offend don’t whine about it

Read full topic

item.title: Recolor
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

That’s why a bunch of us made our own tutorial; wanderer, coon, kracky, even I. As a community, we’ve taken on that responsibility. I’ve had many people tell me thanks for my tutorial. Why not just make a collage of all of our tutorials?

Read full topic

item.title: Recolor
item.dc:creator: @Tribbinator Tribbinator
item.description:
@Tribbinator wrote:

I submit that we need a revamped model tutorial, because the one we have currently teaches the new ones to trace, and then as a community we turn around and yell at them. To the new modellers, we seem extremely hypocritical, as our accepted tutorial teaches them to trace AND recolor through ints.

Im not saying Charlie’s tutorial is bad, is was excellent at the time. Now we (as a community) have a new sense of arrogance and only accept ‘primitive’ models. We think this whole thing is a huge problem with the newbie’s, but whose fault is it really? It wouldnt kill us to donate a portion of a tutorial to stop all this, would it?

There is nothing to complain about but our own lazyness and unwillingness to guide the “annoying” new modellers down a path that leads them in the correct direction.

If you dont believe me, visit our most recent recolor topic – http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,482827.0.html – and take a moment to read the responses given to this guy. The poor fellow probably took a long time to recolor that, because no one has taught him better.

I frankly find it repulsive the state the model section’s society is in.

Read full topic

item.title: Recolor
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Fuck me in the ass with a curling iron if you so please, but I picked yes.

That main tutorial on modeling thats stickied somewhere, what does that go over? Recoloring and making slight adjustments. My first model was a recolored and edited Dragon 2H sword, my second was a slightly edited and recolored obsidian shield. Of course I got flamed for the second one, but since my first model was good and accepted (It was edited beyond recognition :s), I continued on with modeling. You can’t just flame kids for making a recolor as their first model, as they likely learned from here, and thats what the tutorial here teaches. Do you have any idea what kind of talent we could be losing if we flame kids so much over a stupid recolor? They could go on to be an incredible modeler and work for major 3D animation companies, you never know what some people can do.

If anything should really be changed, it would be that stickied tutorial, and I would gladly write a new one, going over other methods of modeling, primitive and tracing, and I’d try to cover everything the best I can to my abilities. Aside from that, recolors shouldn’t be hated. Its a recolor, its usually the person’s first “model”, and they really don’t know any better at all, so give them a break and find something better to do than flame a new modeler. So yes, recolors should be allowed, and we should encourage other types of modeling rather than raging on some kids.

EDIT: I remember seeing a tutorial with an edited silverlight when I was first learning, and that was the tutorial I meant, not SilentCJ’s that goes over tracing and how to use Meta.

Read full topic

item.title: Recolor
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Wildyscape562:

Are you talking about Colored ones like blue instead of default colors? if so AGREED 1000% . I think they should be the color they came to be, maybe color the handle but not the blade unless you put designs on them, but make them worth it lol…

Basically any model that is not at least 90% your creation, and just recolored from someone elses work.
